revision_content.description: Understand the language of algebra, its rules, expressions, equations, and how to solve problems using logic and reasoning.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Algebra
subtopics.definition: Algebra is a branch of mathematics that uses letters and symbols to represent numbers and quantities in formulas and equations.

example.question: If x = 3, what is the value of 2x + 4?

subtopics.whyItMatters: Algebra helps us solve everyday problems logically, like budgeting, planning, or comparing quantities.
quickTips: Think of letters like mystery boxes hiding numbers.
Substitute values into expressions to find answers.

subtopics.whyItMatters: Expressions are like math sentences. You need them to solve bigger math stories.
quickTips: Only like terms can be added or subtracted (e.g. x with x, not x with y).

subtopics.title: Like and Unlike Terms
subtopics.definition: Like terms have the same variables raised to the same power. Unlike terms donâ€™t.

example.question: Are 4xy and 7yx like terms?
example.answer: Yes, because multiplication is commutative (xy = yx).

subtopics.whyItMatters: Knowing what to combine helps you simplify and solve faster.
quickTips: Check variable types and powers carefully.

subtopics.title: Simplifying Expressions
subtopics.definition: This means reducing an expression to its simplest form by combining like terms.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Simplification makes problems clearer and easier to work with.
quickTips: Always start with combining like terms.
Be careful with signs, especially negatives!

subtopics.title: Substitution in Algebra
subtopics.definition: Replacing a variable in an expression with its actual value.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Substitution helps test solutions and solve real-world problems.
quickTips: Put brackets around values when substituting.
Follow BIDMAS/BODMAS order of operations.

subtopics.title: Solving Linear Equations in One Variable
subtopics.definition: Finding the value of the unknown that makes the equation true.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Solving equations is key in planning, designing, or balancing anything involving quantities.
quickTips: Keep both sides balanced â€” what you do on one side, do on the other.
Work step-by-step to isolate the variable.

subtopics.title: Equations with Brackets
subtopics.definition: Equations that contain brackets and need expansion before solving.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Real-world problems often involve multiple steps â€” this builds that skill.
quickTips: Expand brackets before solving.
Watch out for signs when distributing.
